title: What's Going On
composer: Marvin Gaye / Al Cleveland / Renaldo Benson

musicalLanguage.description: Marvin Gaye's smooth soul masterpiece floats on lush major seventh chords and a gently swaying rhythm. The arrangement emphasizes the song's dreamy quality with rich chord voicings in the left hand and a lyrical, unhurried melody in the right. The Emaj7 tonality gives it a warm, golden color.
musicalLanguage.structure: Verse vamp: Emaj7-C#m7 alternation (4 bars), Bridge: F#m7-B7 movement (4 bars)
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: Emaj7 to C#m7 — the signature floating vamp.
Bar 5: F#m7 — the harmony shifts and the energy lifts.
Bar 8: B7 turnaround — smooth dominant pull back to the top.
teachingGoals: Major seventh chord voicings and their smooth sound
Relaxed groove playing — sitting back on the beat
Voice leading between related seventh chords
styleTips: Everything should feel effortless — never push or rush
The chords should shimmer, not thump — light left hand touch
Think of the melody as Marvin's voice — smooth, floating, intimate

measures.teachingNote: Emaj7 — golden, warm. Melody descends gently through the chord.
C#m7 — relative minor. Melody climbs back up.
Emaj7 again — the vamp repeats. Settle into the groove.
C#m7 — longer descent this time. Building toward the bridge.
F#m7 — new harmonic color. The melody lifts with fresh energy.
B7 — dominant chord. Smooth tension wanting to resolve.
Back to Emaj7 — the resolution feels like coming home.
C#m7 ending — the rest lets the chord ring out and fade.
